item.title: Icy road next to entrance to my work place, 8th February
item.description:
On 7th Januray 2026 at approximately 8:50, I slipped and fell at this location due to an icy road/pavement surface. The ice appeared to have formed maybe of an uneven/damaged section of the pavement which allowed water to collect and freeze. As a result of the fall, I injured my right arm and required medical attention. I have also been unable to work since the incident, I live alone and just finding the injury very challenging to do some of the normal day to day tasks. I am reporting this as a safety hazard so it can be inspected and made safe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beaverwood Road, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: So much litter, 8th February
item.description:
Hi Please can a thorough litter pick be done in the area circled red. Far too much to photograph. Ranges from empty bleach bottle to door mat, glass bottles, vapes, dog poo bags, bits of cardboard, cans, bits of plastic, take away wrappers and more. It's building up every day. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Lime Grove, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
